dialogue.text: Hey Tsuneyo. What are you doing?
No response.
Is she looking at the board or something?
I glance over Tsuneyo’s shoulder to see if there’s a flyer for...noodles or something, but everything up there seems to be normal.
Hello? Earth to Tsuneyo.
Do you ever just...think about whales?
Not really, no.
Did you know that the life expectancy of the blue whale is anywhere from 80-90 years?
Though, there are some cases in which whales have lived for much longer.
Thank you for this information that I will likely never use again.
You’re welcome.
So...what are you up to tonight?
Thinking about whales.
I see that. What {i}else{/i} are you up to?
Talking about whales?
What I’m asking is if you have any plans.
I don’t have anything to do, so I wanted to see if you’d be down to hang out for a bit.
In the hallway?
It doesn’t have to be the hallway. We could go to your room if you’d like.
I think I’d prefer the hallway.
Being alone in a room with a boy is something I’m supposed to avoid.
Wait, so I’ll never be allowed in?
You probably will.
I tend to cave under pressure.
It's whatever. I'm fine with talking in the hallway, I guess.
I just prefer a topic slightly more interesting than the amount of time whales live.
I can probably manage that.
Have you met Noodles?
We literally named him together, Tsuneyo.
Ah-
I’m surprised he’s still up there. How does a bird even get into the dorms?
Perhaps he is enrolled at the[school]?
How would a bird even enroll?
It’s crazy what you can do with a computer nowadays.
He literally does not have hands. He can’t type.
Wait, he doesn’t know how to read either. This entire topic is flawed.
I had no idea you hated birds so much.
What did Noodles ever do to you?
I don’t hate birds. I just don’t think-
You just don’t think they should be allowed to attend[school] like the rest of us.
No, that’s-
Actually. Yes, that’s right.
Noodles, attack.
Caw!
Oh, he actually makes noise.
That’s not all he can do.
What is that supposed to-
Caw!
What the fuck?
Where did it get such a small knife?
Do not ask questions you are afraid to hear the answers to.
You gave the bird a knife, didn’t you?
Tsuneyo.
Well, I couldn’t just say no to him.
He {i}asked{/i} you for one?
I thought maybe he wanted to learn how to prepare dinner for his family.
He doesn’t have a family, though. He would have gone back to them already.
Perhaps he is just a horrible parent?
If birds are able to attend[school], it is also possible that they, too, struggle with certain family values from time to time.
They...can’t attend[school], though. How did we get back to this?
Noodles, attack.
Caw!
Noodles, don’t attack.
Why does he only respond to you?
He is thankful that I provided him the tools he needs to prepare dinner for his family.
If you’re going to go with that dinner excuse, you’re going to need to tell him to stop attacking me.
Don’t force Noodles into a life of murder.
What is my life becoming?
Caw! {i}(Perhaps it’s because you’ve become too complacent with your current life and are just looking for that “chase” once again.)
Caw! Caw! {i}(Or perhaps you find comfort in knowing that there is someone with a fresh view of not only you, but of everything.)
Caaaaw! {i}(A worldview untainted by the evils of man. Just a girl with a passion for her craft and not a care in the world about romance.)
Caw! {i}(Or perhaps you just want to return things to how they should be?){/i}
Okay, I think it might be time for me to leave.
Already? Why?
I’m beginning to think the bird is talking to me.
But he is talking to you.
I taught Noodles about existentialism.
...How?
Why?
Caw!
If you are leaving, would you mind if I asked you a question first?
Sure, whatever. What is it?
It’s kind of personal, so I apologize if this crosses any lines.
Just ask the question, Tsuneyo.
Okay. Well...here goes.
Tsuneyo begins to blush and bashfully looks away from me, clearly nervous about whatever she’s about to ask.
Do you think you could...
Tell me what your favorite breed of whale is?
Nope. See you later, Tsuneyo.
Have fun with your bird.
But he is {i}our{/i} bird.
You can’t just walk out on us like this.
He hasn’t even started[school] yet.
See you tomorrow.
Get back here, you bastard.
Well, that certainly was...
One way to spend a Wednesday night.
Tsuneyo is confusing...
And what the fuck was up with that bird?
{i}Somewhere, off in the distance, the cawing of an existential bird rings out.{/i}
{i}Tsuneyo’s affection has increased to [tsuneyo_love]!{/i}
